vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πολῠ-κέφᾰλος, ον,
many-headed, θηρίον [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of plants, interpolated in [Refs 1st c.AD+]; π. στρέβλα (with allusion to [LXX+5th c.BC+]; νόμος π., a celebrated air on the flute, so called from its expressing the hissing of the serpents round the Gorgon's head, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: the hissing of the serpents round the Gorgon's head
vocabInfos.mediumDef: the hissing of the serpents round the Gorgon's head
vocabInfos.stepGloss: the hissing of the serpents round the Gorgon's head
